seniority_level.evidence: Minimum 3 years of experience required and no senior title mentioned; aligns with typical mid‑level data engineer expectations.

job_family.evidence: Job title is "Data Engineer‑Business Intelligence" and responsibilities focus on ETL, reporting and data warehouse tasks.

sub_specialty.evidence: Role emphasizes BI/DW projects, reporting with Cognos and ETL tools, typical of data‑warehouse engineering.

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of people‑management, team lead or architectural authority; responsibilities are individual contributor focused.

primary_cloud.evidence: Must‑have skills list includes AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure, indicating experience across multiple cloud platforms.

secondary_clouds.evidence: All three clouds are treated as required; no single primary cloud can be isolated.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on ETL/Data Integration tools (DataStage, Informatica, Azure Data Factory) and BI reporting, typical batch processing workloads.

orchestrator_category.evidence: Job description does not reference Airflow, Luigi, dbt, or any orchestration tool.

storage_layer.evidence: Role centers on Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse projects; no lake or lakehouse technologies are cited.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location is specified as Pune, Maharashtra, India with no remote‑work language; implies candidates must be based in India.

timezone_focus.evidence: India falls in the APAC region; no other timezone constraints are mentioned.

relocation_required.evidence: Job posting does not mention relocation assistance or a requirement to move; assumes candidates are already in Pune.

h1b_friendly.evidence: No explicit statement about H‑1B sponsorship; absence suggests it is not offered.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of OPT/CPT eligibility; default assumption is not explicitly supported.

citizenship_required.evidence: Neither citizenship nor work‑authorization requirements are described in the posting.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Employment type is listed as full‑time, which for IBM implies a regular employee (W‑2) arrangement.

benefits_level.evidence: Pass‑1 extraction shows no benefits listed; posting contains no benefit details.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: The description does not discuss career ladders, promotion tracks, or growth opportunities.

mentorship_signals.evidence: No reference to mentorship programs, mentors, or learning from senior staff.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No language about promotions, advancement, or moving to higher titles appears in the posting.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: The posting does not mention internal transfers or mobility within IBM.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit mention of IC, management, specialist, or architect tracks.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Multiple mandatory hard skills (Cognos, three cloud platforms, three ETL tools, Agile) plus required Master's degree and 3+ years experience indicate a stringent requirement set.

scope_definition.evidence: Job description is focused on BI/DW data engineering tasks without mixing other roles.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: The skill set aligns with a mid‑level data engineer; no unrealistic senior‑level expectations for a 3‑year candidate.
